channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023080579
item.description:
Report X-2023080579

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: FLETCHER
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on trailer. Package wet and put in a plastic tub and moved to the QA Staging location. DescribePack: failure was the loose cap on bottle which caused leakage that damaged package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moved form the QA staging location to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023080567
item.description:
Report X-2023080567

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by a manager at door 124 at KANN-289. Hazmat was brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection. During the inspection it was found that the cap was broken/missing. The remaining cap was missing and not found inside the packaging. DescribePack: The failure was due to a broken/missing cap on one of the glass bottles. No other caps or bottles were damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottles and package were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080538
item.description:
Report X-2023080538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA AFTER THE SORT AND THE BOTTOM WAS WET. 1 OF THE BOTTLES BUSTED INSIDE THE BOX AND LEAKED OUT. UNSURE OF HOW BOTTLE BROKE AND NO OTHER INFO WAS GIVEN TO ME. PKG WAS THEN SECURED AND LATER PROCESSED AS DAMAGED. DescribePack: BOTTLE BROKE INSIDE. INNER PACKING SEEMED FINE. NO HOLES, CRACKS, OR ANYTHING TO SIGNALS THIS WAS A PACKAGING ISSUE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM AND TAKEN OFF THE SORT AND SECURED.

item.title: Report E-2023080194
item.description:
Report E-2023080194

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Loader failed t properly close loading external valve. Movement of loaded cargo tank caused material to exit valve and release .5 gallons of material. Driver properly closed external valve and cleaned material. Delivery made without additional incident.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of stain (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 3 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, co no contractors were dispatched.
